benchmark_details.name: MLAgentBench
benchmark_details.overview: MLAgentBench is a general framework for specifying well-scoped executable tasks and automatically evaluating agents on these tasks in the context of machine learning experimentation. It includes 13 tasks ranging from improving model performance on datasets like CIFAR-10 to recent research problems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Evaluate language models as agents for performing machine learning experimentation effectively.

data.source: Various machine learning datasets: CIFAR-10, imdb, ogbn-arxiv, house-price, spaceship-titanic, etc.

methodology.calculation: Each task assigns a performance metric score based on the final submission against a baseline.
methodology.interpretation: Success is defined as achieving at least a 10% improvement over the baseline.
methodology.validation: Agents are evaluated across multiple tasks with varying difficulties to assess their generalizability.
